> 
> Got a fix that worked for me ... i made a new install to see if I could get the errors you guys get, and here's what I did to fix it.... delete all he mods you have installed except for KK, start your game And make  new save, quit the game and delete the statics folder in the KK directory, install all the mods you want including<abbr style="border-bottom-width:1px;border-bottom-style:dotted;color:rgb(39,42,52);font-family:'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:20.8px;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;word-spacing:0px;background-color:rgb(255,255,255);" title="Realism Overhaul (mod)"><abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)"><abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr></abbr></abbr>/<abbr style="border-bottom-width:1px;border-bottom-style:dotted;color:rgb(39,42,52);font-family:'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:20.8px;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white-space:normal;word-spacing:0px;background-color:rgb(255,255,255);" title="Real Solar System (mod)"><abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)"><abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr></abbr></abbr>, start the game and you have to use the save that you made on the beginning of this tutorial... that's what fixed it for me
> 

Is this workaround working for anyone? I am wondering if I am not doing something correct?

I removed all mods except KerbalKonstructs and of course Squad, and started KSP.  I loaded my existing career then saved that to a new save called KK.  Next I quit KSP and deleted the KerbalKonstructs/statics folder.  Lastly I copied back all my mods, loaded KSP, loaded my career and loaded the KK save I had made.  But after doing all this, in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> the KK button does nothing, and if I go to the launchpad it is unchanged.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, Agathorn said:
> 
> 
> Is this workaround working for anyone? I am wondering if I am not doing something correct?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I removed all mods except KerbalKonstructs and of course Squad, and started KSP.  I loaded my existing career then saved that to a new save called KK.  Next I quit KSP and deleted the KerbalKonstructs/statics folder.  Lastly I copied back all my mods, loaded KSP, loaded my career and loaded the KK save I had made.  But after doing all this, in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr> the KK button does nothing, and if I go to the launchpad it is unchanged.
> 

I don't think you're doing it correctly. You loaded your existing career and copied it over as a new save, the workaround only works if you create a new save from scratch. Then you can copy that new save and modify its parameters and duplicate it and it works (for me at least).

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Bev7787 said:
> 
> 
> I don't think you're doing it correctly. You loaded your existing career and copied it over as a new save, the workaround only works if you create a new save from scratch. Then you can copy that new save and modify its parameters and duplicate it and it works (for me at least).
> 

I didn't copy it over.  From the main menu I went to Start Game, then Load Game and selected my career.  The once in game I hit Esc and went to Save and saved it as KK.  Then when I restarted I loaded that.

Are you saying I need to start a brand new career playthrough? Also what do you mean by "modify its parameters".  I saw nothing about that step?
did you remove the Statics folder in your KK dierectory?]

After having worked there for 16 of my 21 years at NASA, you need to put alligators in all the lakes, including one that wanders in and out of the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr>/SPF's, and a few that loiter on 33/15 along with wading birds galore lol.

Still remember a night landing, was listening to the 1 hour deorbit runway clearing and all you hear on an open mic was \*\*bleep. bleep, bleepy bleepty\*\* think we just hit a \*\*bleepin\* gator.
